**Plant Cozy**: Use a colorful sock as a decorative plant cozy. Simply cut the sock to fit around the base of a small potted plant, giving it a fun and unique look while also helping to retain moisture in the soil. This can add a pop of color to your home decor while providing some insulation for the roots.

**Sock Puppet Theater**: Transform an old sock into a puppet for storytelling or educational purposes. You can draw or glue on facial features, add yarn for hair, and use it as a fun tool to engage children in reading or learning activities. This can also be a great way to teach kids about emotions and social interactions.

**Dusting Mitt**: Slip a clean sock over your hand and use it as a dusting mitt. The fabric will easily attract dust and dirt from surfaces like shelves, blinds, and electronics. This eco-friendly alternative to disposable dusters can be washed and reused, making it a sustainable cleaning solution.

**Travel Laundry Bag**: When traveling, use a clean sock as a makeshift laundry bag for dirty clothes. Just stuff your used items inside the sock, tie it off, and toss it into your suitcase. This keeps your dirty laundry separate from clean clothes and can help save space in your luggage.

**Scented Sachet**: Fill an old sock with dried lavender, rosemary, or cedar chips to create a scented sachet. Tie the end of the sock securely and place it in drawers, closets, or your car to keep things smelling fresh. This is an easy and eco-friendly way to repurpose socks while adding a pleasant aroma to your space.
